item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ossory Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Protective railings needs to be extended to protect pedestrians, 9th September
item.description:
The railings need to be extended to protect more of the pavement area against vehicles buses and trucks that swerve into the pavement due to the turn in the road. There is a nursery here and a lot of pedestrian activity. A car swerved into the pavement and hit the wall of 73 Amersham Road. Luckily there no pedestrians passing at that moment or they would have been run over. There have been a few of these crashes in the last few years and the railing helps but it should be extended to cover the curve in the road and extra 3m or so. This could save someone’s life!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amersham Road, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Display of right wing flag in communal area, 9th September
item.description:
Someone hung up a Knights Templar flag along the net on the first floor of the building for flats 33-62 Parkside Estate overnight. It's now been removed by a resident, but seeing such displays clearly inciting hatred in a communal space is not acceptable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rutland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
